Text:
Things are probably getting started at the target
hideout as well.

I've searched the bodies of the merchants and various
documents belonging to them, but there are no clues
of any connection to the Cult.

I guess their actions were purely rooted in malicious
intent toward the former Luna, Ltd., now Mitsugoshi,
Ltd.
Aghh... It's over now...

Whew! A slight improvement, but still no match for
me!
I guess that leaves you.
E-Eeeek...! Wh-Who are you people...?!
There's no need for you to know.
Agghhh!!!

...They're not minions of the Cult, just individuals
with bad intentions. Look how little resistance they
put up when we clashed forces.
Lady Alpha, why didn't you tell them who we are?

Well...they were wary of Luna, Ltd. That means they
had excellent intuition and an eye for the future.

In other words, opponents not to be underestimated...
So I didn't want to provide them with clues that could
expose our identity.
...I don't really get it, but is that how it works?
Yes, that's how it works.

We, the Shadow Garden, are a secret organization that
lurks in the shadows to destroy the Cult of Diablos.

Ultimately, Mitsugoshi, Ltd.'s existence is just
another means to an end.

...We've destroyed several companies attempting to
sabotage our activities.

In the wake of the Shadow Garden's expansion, there
will be no lack of obstacles beyond the Cult of Diablos.

Still, I'd like to keep things as civil as possible
between us and those unaffiliated with the Cult.

Well, I guess sometimes you have to fight fire with
fire.
Yes...whether we like it or not.

For all we know, the Cult could have been scheming
with them against the Garden at this very moment.
Cid? What do you meanâ€”?
I mean, come on, Alpha.

Even if they had no connection to the Cult, there's a
good chance the Cult would've eventually made contact
with a group clearly at odds with the Garden.

Much like us, the Cult of Diablos operates in this
world with its true identity concealed.

They would've likely seen those capable of making
strategic waves in the public sphere as potential
pawns to handle without risk.

If the Cult had plans to contact these companies,
even by mere coincidence, we beat them to it.

I didn't even think of that! How could've I been so
blind?

So in a sense, we've preemptively nipped any seeds of
collaboration with the Cult in the bud!
Thank you for making me realize this, Cid.

As usual, your eyes see things that nobody else can
see.

(What a fitting albeit strained analogy, if I might
say so myself. It takes a lot of work for me to come
up with these scenarios while avoiding plot holes.)

(It also helps a ton that Alpha's adapted to me
playing my shadowbroker roleâ€”she picks up
what I put down almost immediately.)

(I'll conveniently avoid questioning why a bunch of
generic companies would ever be at odds with an
organization that lurks in the shadows.)
Heh... Just don't take your eyes off the ball, Alpha.
Yes, for you, Shadow, and the Shadow Garden!
Is something the matter, my lady?

Nothing reallyâ€”it's just that this fragrance smells
different from my usual perfume.

My apologies! One of the companies regularly
supplying goods to the Church has been out of
business for the past week after their president's
untimely death.

Today, we've prepared a perfume purchased from
another company. We'll arrange for the original
product as soon as possible.
I see... May their lost soul rest in peace.
...Why is my heart fluttering...?

Lady Victoria, your followers await you. Please make
the necessary preparations.
Yes, I'll be right there.
